alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 6:36PM EST until February 10 at 9:40PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Liberty, Calhoun, Gulf and Franklin Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Blountstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...From this evening to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur at Douglas Landing and Willis Landing Campgrounds in Gulf County. The 19.0 ft level at Blountstown may at times not be representative of river levels in these areas due to tidal effects, winds, or local rainfall and should be used with caution. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM CST Saturday /6:15 PM EST Saturday/ the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 19.1 feet Sunday. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 01/22/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
